text: Groundtastic is a quarterly magazine published in the United Kingdom about football grounds. ==History== The magazine was first published in March 1995 by Paul Claydon, Vince Taylor and Jon Weaver.Football grounds remembered BBC London, 30 January 2008 Although largely focussed on football grounds in the United Kingdom, it also features stadiums from around the world.A place like home When Saturday Comes, issue 249, November 2007 Its articles cover the construction and renovation of grounds, as well as detailing football ground histories.Groundtastic – by far the greatest mag the world has ever seen US Soccer Players The magazine has an annual award for best new non-League ground of the year.New grounds for joy Manchester Evening News, 7 December 2005 The magazine was featured as a guest publication on Have I Got News for You,Grounds for celebration as my favourite read reaches fever pitch The Yorkshire Post, 13 September 2007 and has been described by poet and playwright Ian McMillan as "the greatest magazine in the world."Ian McMillan: pieces of me The Guardian, 5 December 2008 ==References== ==External links== *Official website Category:1995 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:Association football magazines Category:Football mass media in the United Kingdom Category:Magazines established in 1995 Category:Mass media in Essex Category:Quarterly magazines published in the United Kingdom Category:Sports magazines published in the United Kingdom
